oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Camel Rock & Roll Dance Party - 1956-03-31 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: CBS Rock 'N' Roll Dance Party program sponsored by Camel cigarettes, 1956-03-31 part 1. Hosted by Alan Freed with announcer Bern Bennett, starring Count Basie and his Orchestra with vocalist Joe Williams, and featuring Sunny Gale, and the Rover Boys featuring Billy Albert. Produced and directed by Lou Melamed.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Count Basie Orchestra; Sunny Gale; Rover Boys; Billy Albert
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (Alan Freed) -- Opening theme -- Opening statement (Bern Bennett) -- Alan Freed introduces Count Basie and his Orchestra -- Soft Drink (Count Basie Orchestra) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Alan Freed introduces Sunny Gale -- Winner Take All (Sunny Gale) -- Alan Freed introduces the Rover Boys featuring Billy Albert -- Sixteen Teens (Rover Boys, Billy Albert) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Camel Ciagarettes jingle -- Alan Freed introduces Count Basie and his Orchestra -- Corner Pocket (Count Basie Orchestra)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; WCBS (Radio station : New York, N.Y.); R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Company; Camel rock 'n roll dance party (Radio program); Freed, Alan; Bennett, Bern, 1921-2014; Basie, Count, 1904-1984; Count Basie Orchestra; Williams, Joe, 1918-1999; Gale, Sunny (Vocalist); Rover Boys (Musical group); Albert, Billy (Vocalist); Melamed, Louis
